page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: We have found that the South End of Roos is the most modern.This area has been developed over the past 15 years. Prior to this it was mainly open fields.Any buildings were linked to the fsrms.This part of Roos has many small woods and mature trees.The South End has the only religious buildings (church and oratory) left in the village.Originally there were two chapels,but they have been knocked down over the past decade.The village seems to be seperated from its Northend.Northend is almost a village in itself.There is a high proportion of farms at the Northend,this reflects the rural aspect of the village.Most of the houses are pre-war and some are very much older.The majority of houses are large and detached,separated from eachother by fields.
